cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds play crucial roles in ecosystems worldwide.
Birds contribute to nutrient cycling in ecosystems.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links an organism or taxonomic group to the ecosystem context in which it plays one or more ecological roles or functions.
args.justification: Both relations describe birds performing or playing ecological roles within ecosystems; the key shared predicate is that birds have ecological roles in an ecosystem context, so they can be normalized to a single functional-role predicate.
args.remark: The object for RelR_343e3478734c is modeled as 'ecological roles of birds' rather than a specific ecosystem; this still expresses that birds possess/perform ecological roles in an ecosystem context, which fits the same predicate semantics.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links an organism or taxonomic group to an ecosystem process or function that it helps to maintain or drive.
args.justification: This relation specifically states that birds contribute to a particular ecosystem process (nutrient cycling), which is narrower than generic role-holding and better captured as contribution to a process.

All three relations connect birds to ecosystem-level functions or processes (general ecological roles or specific processes like nutrient cycling), forming a coherent family of organism–ecosystem-function relations.

Each relation specifies the functional role or contribution of birds within ecosystems or ecosystem processes, which fits a broad functionality/role dimension rather than pure composition, identity, or spatiality.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Links an organism or taxonomic group to the ecosystem context in which it plays one or more ecological roles or functions.
executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe birds performing or playing ecological roles within ecosystems; the key shared predicate is that birds have ecological roles in an ecosystem context, so they can be normalized to a single functional-role predicate.
executed_decisions.remark: The object for RelR_343e3478734c is modeled as 'ecological roles of birds' rather than a specific ecosystem; this still expresses that birds possess/perform ecological roles in an ecosystem context, which fits the same predicate semantics.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Links an organism or taxonomic group to an ecosystem process or function that it helps to maintain or drive.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation specifically states that birds contribute to a particular ecosystem process (nutrient cycling), which is narrower than generic role-holding and better captured as contribution to a process.

All three relations connect birds to ecosystem-level functions or processes (general ecological roles or specific processes like nutrient cycling), forming a coherent family of organism–ecosystem-function relations.

Each relation specifies the functional role or contribution of birds within ecosystems or ecosystem processes, which fits a broad functionality/role dimension rather than pure composition, identity, or spatiality.
